Award.AwardTitle: 6th INFORMS Simulation Society Research Workshop; University Park, Pennsylvania; June 22-24, 2020

Division.LongName: Div Of Civil, Mechanical, & Manufact Inn

Award.AbstractNarration:
The Institute for Operations Research and the Management Sciences (INFORMS) Simulation Society Research Workshop is a periodic event to convene researchers in simulation methods around an emerging research theme, with a stated goal of encouraging participation of graduate students and junior researchers working in simulation and related areas. The theme of the 6th Workshop is "From Data to Decision Making: Contending with Uncertainty and Non-stationarity in Simulation Research", and this version of the workshop will feature a day-long simulation summer school for graduate students and junior faculty members on foundational topics in simulation modeling. This award will provide funds for eight graduate students and junior faculty to attend the Workshop and Summer School, each of whom will be presenting his or her talk or poster at the workshop. Participation in the Workshop and Summer School will provide students and junior faculty with an opportunity to highlight their ongoing work and network with other researchers from industry and academia.

The 6th INFORMS Simulation Society Research Workshop will be held June 22-24, 2020, in University Park, Pennsylvania. The solicitation for the travel support opportunity will be sent to a variety of mailing lists, with particular effort to broaden participation by attracting students and junior faculty from underrepresented groups in engineering. By providing travel funds for graduate students and junior faculty, NSF will help to decrease the cost of attendance to encourage participation of students and will support the engagement of STEM students in emerging research in the field of simulation.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
Update: The online version of the workshop is scheduled to occur between June 21st and 23rd with a Simulation Summer School to be held on June 20th.

 

(i)             Simulation Summer School (S3). The simulation summer school will be run on Sunday June 20th and will have four speakers, each of whom will give a tutorial. These are as follows: Perspectives on Simulation Optimization, with Bonus Features: Shane Henderson (Cornell);  Emerging Topics in Simulation: Henry Lam (Columbia University); Mathematics of Simulation: Chang-Han Rhee (Northwestern University); Gaussian Process Metamodeling for Simulation: Eunhye Song (Penn State University).We currently have over 35 participants for the summer school.

(ii)            Main workshop: The main workshop will span three days and will include 3 plenaries, approximately 30 research talks, 1 panel on simulation, software, and computing, and a series of poster presentations. The flier for the workshop is provided on the next page while the agenda is on the third page.

(iii)          None of the NSF support has been utilized since the entire workshop will be run online.

 

Plan for utilization of NSF funds. Our goal lies in utilizing the NSF funds in the next three years by organizing an East Coast winter school that will cover similar tutorial topics in simulation theory. The NSF funds will support the participation of graduate students and young faculty members with an emphasis on drawing from under-represented groups. Given the uncertainty arising from COVID-19, we are unclear regarding when an in-person meeting can be organized but expect that this will be possible within a three year window.
